caption: I have been a customer since 1986. The best local pizza and comfort food.
Best pizza ever.

Had dinner with my mom here for my birthday. My second time here, the pizza is amazing. I love the atmosphere, and the decor, which is part of the reason I come here. This place has a pub style family diner feel, and I'm glad they're still in business. George the waiter took great care of us. Thank you all so much!

My daughter chose this place for her birthday celebration. She had been here before, but I hadn’t. The pizza, the decor, the service, were all fantastic. Our server, George, was always running, and single-handedly kept all the customers happy. We didn’t have to wait very long for anything. It was like taking a step back into the 70s. All of the decor in the whole place is original. And the pizza was by far the best pizza I have ever had. Love this place, love the pizza!

5 stars but said 4 bc the caprese salad is prob the worst salad Ive ever had. If you like caprese salads don't waste your time. PIZZA IS GREAT. If I hadn't loved them for years I would have shunned and scolded them for such sub par low quality salad

Really poor. Ordered through their website with an estimated delivery time of 45-60 mins. Arrived 2h15m later freezing cold. Called after the cild food arrived and was told I can have a $10 credit. After explaining I ordered through their website  not grubhub, I was told to call grubhub. If you want cold food with attitude go for it
The pizza was fire 😋 buttered crust but the restaurant looks old and in need of remodeling
We been going for years  .my family and friends ❤ love it.  Food is always good 👍,  so you enjoy it 🍕🍕 and much  much more 😋
Best pizza everrrrrrrr 🍕
Love their pizza
Best tavern style in Chicago. I hope this place stays open forever.
Have never had a bad thin crust pie here. So good

My friend picked up a pizza last night (12/8/20) and said the young man working the counter (wish I knew his name) was one of the kindest, most polite employees he has ever encountered at a business. Beyond that, the thin crust sausage pizza is the best, most authentic pizza I’ve had in a long time.
A long-time favourite been going there since the sixties
Still my favorite Pizza 🍕, I've been going to John's Pizza for years, , I live in NW Indiana and I still make the drive.

I got my first calzone (mushrooms &garlic) from here the other night and it was momentously FLAME🔥 Like $15 with tax. Definitely big enough to split with another person if you also get a side order or an appetizer.
Love there Pizza, I've been eating here since I've been small. GREAT FOOD!
There pizza is the best thing crust in town.
Great old school restaurant
Thin pizza is 8.8 / 10.... loved it
love their pizza

While this place may have decent food, their service lacks big time. Nobody there cares about customer service...except for George.  They decide to charge whatever they want even if the menu clearly states a price and what's included. My last occasion,  I was hung up on.
Best thin crust in Chicago, hands down
The Best for the football sausage pizza. Over 40 years of buying this carry out order
Great Chicago tavern style pizza
Terrible service.  Staff is very unprofessional.  Restaurant is dark and dingy.  Kitchen noises dominate. Decor is dated and dingy
This place is the real deal. It's humble but well established, a true family run and family friendly place. Great pizza and a neighborhood treasure.
Delicious pizza!
Got a large half & half Pizza to go.  Overall, pretty tasty, but wish a little more sauce.
I love there pizza and ribs but they dont make the ribs anymore.
Great pizza and pasta..
lots of flavor in this pizza. could be due to the sauce. i recommend johns
love love love
Excellent pizza. A Bucktown favorite for over 50 years.
It's been my family best pizza place for almost ,50 yrs never changes sad to hear it's closing  Best times I had grew up right nextdoor
Love it becuz I've been going there since I was a lil girl and they have the best dren pizza
Hands down the best Pizza in Chicago.
Excellent pizza for pick-up or delivery. Just don't add garlic because they don't use fresh.
The food is great and the atmosphere is quiet peaceful.
Sausage, garlic, and onion, thin crust pizza (ordered well done) was amazing! Red wine vinegar salad dressing was also so good! Loved it!

Ordered a pizza from there on Wednesday went there to pick it up , guy working on the credit card machine rang card 3 times and tried manually entering number. Told me the card isn't working. Card was working it was the guy on the machine that didn't know what he was doing. I asked for him to get someone to help him never happened so I left without the pizza. Came home and called John's explained my situation with phone operator was put on hold for 22 minutes never spoke  to anyone nor did they call me back .Now I go to my bank to find out my card was canceled due to fraud with John's pizza BEWARE !!!!

Lived in wicker park my entire life. Tried to be a new customer. Person taking my order couldn't have cared less. After ignoring me and jumping to conclusions, my order was repeatedly misrepresented. After 10 min on the phone I was told pickup was no longer an option. I live down the street so I asked why. After being passed to two people who apparently did not know why they were talking to me, I got to their condescending manager. Seeing many other reviews with the same issues. Plenty of good pizza and pasta around to deal with people like that.
U want Good pizza this is the place rigth here pickup☎ call food is good 💯⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Football takes the cake.
Best thin cut pizza in the city of Chicago!! I promise!  Also they could make so much more money if they updated the inside and added a bar to have drinks!
To me very traditional thin crust pizza,, sure it may have a little extra Grease,, but overall when I come to Chicago and want a thin crust pizza I'll stop John's pizzeria
It's closing soon selling the property. Good tasting thin pizza
Garlic bread
Great pizza! Too bad it's closing.
Best pizza in town.

Horrible customer service by the owner/manager.  We ordered a pizza that was completely undercooked, soggy crust, cheese wasn’t even cooked in the middle.  When I called and spoke with him he said he didn’t believe me and was extremely rude.
Best f-ing pizza in the city
This place is awesome!  It will truly be missed when it closes. Such great memories great food & the young gentleman server is great!!
ABSOLUTE GOLD PIZZA, NO NONSENSE PIZZA
Best pizza on earth!! Always come from Miami for John's pizza😀
Best thin crust on the north side
I've been coming since I was a kid highly recommend it
Great pizza slow service so kinda worth the wait
Love the Pizza ...
Always AMAZING! Going to miss it when it closes 💔
Classicly thin and greasy in the best way. Can't ask for more
Pizza is so great! Just sad it will be closing soon..
I love John's Pizza I come from Indiana To get the best pizza... Do you sale frozen pizza or how can I send a pizza to someone in another state?

This is the most amazing pizza anywhere. The restaurant is cozy. The pizza is tasty. The servers never rush you and take the time to do things right instead of rushing like some chain places do. I now live in the suburbs but still make the drive because it’s completely worth it. Thank you John’s for being the BEST!

Fried chicken was surprisingly good. Generously portioned 4-piece and affordable with soup/salad/fries for under $10. I haven't had the pizza in over a decade, but it was always a good tavern-style option.  Dine-in service was very attentive and helpful, honestly wasn't expecting that. They brought out bread and soup before the meal which was a nice old school touch.  The draw of the place to me, and maybe not to many others is the worn-in timewarp atmosphere of the place. It's in need of TLC and hasn't changed much in several decades. Decorated by framed oil paintings and swag lanterns, godzilla figures, old advertising signs, and cozy old booths. Families have grown up here and have nostalgia for it. Sadly many places like this are disappearing, so enjoy it while it lasts.
Fast food, friendly staff. Usually a pie is done around 15 mins or so even on busier nights.
It was good i like the food there
One of my all time favorite pizza joints in Chicago and as old school as they get - make sure to dine in and get the onion ring tower

Great thin pizza, can be purchased in as large as football size!! We always pick up our pizza but looks like there's always space to dine in (restaurant has a nice retro vibe). John's pizza is a family favorite in the area with a wide variety of menu items & always great tasting pizza!
Great pizza!
They changed how they cook their pizza. Disappointed.
I love their pizza it's my favorite place for pizza and all their food there is flavorful and just so mouthwatering and their service is great!
The pizza is really good, the young man at the register is very respectful..I recommend trying the pizza will go back to try other food there
Best thin ok m the Northside.
Great tasting pizza & great customer service. Our waitress is always so sweet.
Excellent pizza. Super polite service. Drinks available. Quiet, old school dining room. I love it.

Have always enjoyed John's pizza. My wife grew up across the street. Also so often while I was dating her ordering for the entire family. Can't count the amounts of times we've ordered the chicken parmesan, cheese fries, football pizza and fried chicken.
best pizza ever

My group was very unimpressed with the foot of onion rings. They didn't contain actual rings of onion, and mainly just tasted like the breading. The provided sauces were also poor, and we each found ourselves using the best of the worst, rather than one that we actually liked. Beyond that, the restaurant looks very run-down and the service was only ok.

I wish I didn't have to give this restaurant a single star.  The customer service my boyfriend and I received was so disrespectful in all aspects. Not only by an employee but also by the "supposed" manager.  The way they spoke to my boyfriend was demeaning. The pizza we ordered was pepperoni and onion. We received a pizza with sausage, mushrooms, green peppers. I know we would not order a pizza with mushrooms because I am allergic to mushrooms. Instead of finding a solution the staff decided to treat a customer with no respect. I will no longer be ordering from John's Pizzeria. I rather spend by money elsewhere.  I can always find better pizza.
I love pizza
Very friendly service. They have a lot of seating including a lounge section.
Great pizza
I cannot believe this place is still here ! it is a staple of the community-great pizza good food and dining Room hasn't changed yea!!!
IT WAS SO GOOD THAT I HAD DINED IN AND HAD TO ORDER ONE TO BE DELIVERED TO MY HOUSE.THAT PIZZA WAS DELICIOUS.

Ordered a pizza for pick up, picked it up and drove all the way home only to find out it isn't the pizza I ordered. And when I brought this to the attention of management, they were unapologetic and rude. They offered no compensation for my wasted time. I will never order from John's Pizzeria again.
Old school Italian dive, pasta and meals are great. The pizza is OK too
Love the Pizza as always
Good family spot, love the food and have a cocktail too.

Been coming here since I was a kid. My mom and dad always brought us here in Sunday's. So sad to hear that there going to close at the end of the year. Since 1957 John's has had the same great flavor. I wish them the best. You will be missed.. Much love..
Love this place
One of the best places for low key great pizza!
Love it 👍👍👍👍
Great pizza better prices
Great Pizza.
Excellent pizza  great location. My friend Tim turned me on to this place..hes been eating it since 1957 and it's still the best.. nothing much has changed  inside for years but its very clean
Never fails
Ok
I haven't been there in 20 years and they changed the recipes.. not the same....
Veggie pizza nice and hot no dried up veggies, a must!!!!!
I love the food
Too few servers.  We wait a lot... for 2 medium pizzas and 2 spaguettis..  but good flavor
Maannnnn lol Pizza Was DELICIOUS
My favourite pizza ever.. Everytime I come to Chicago I go here have enjoyed Johns pizza for more than 50 years..
Great hidden gem. Pizza was delicious and pasta was amazing. Exactly what you'd expect from an old style family Italian restaurant.
Great service and the food was great also. We had pizza, loaded nachos and cheese fries.
Very good pizza. The staff has been there forever and do a good job
Super friendly staff, best pizza in Chicago!
Good food
Pizza and wings were good but a bit too salty and a little overpriced
One the few decent thin crust joints left in the yuppy cesspool known as the North Side of Chitcago
This is the best pizza place in Bucktown. It's a dive, and I love it. The pizza is greasy and delicious.

Well how should i begin? The Pizza was amazing and i was only one dinning tonight and i heard good reviews about the joint and well the reviews where right it had an amazing pizza i ever had i don't know why people bother going to deep pizza when this tops all! Am not sure about the pricing thou for me it did feel little bit of expensive but hell i enjoyed half n i had other half on the go, so it was worth it. I had great conversation with Larry he's the owner i wish he keeps on going with it. I would highly recommend to any pizza lovers. Wish you all the best! I would bring anyone who would crave for Pizza!
GREAT FOOD SERVED EAT IN ATTENTIVE HAD BEAUTIFUL FAMILY TIME
In the good old days, this was the BEST pizza in the world. Nowadays,  it's inconsistantly mediocre or bad. GO BACK TO THE ORIGINAL RECIPIE AND STICK TO IT. TAKE PRIDE.
Total hidden gem!
Good food fast service.
Good pizza
Took my dad there. He wanted authentic Italian pizza and baam. Jackpot. Very good place. Friendly and very delicious pizza.
Great food.     So sad you guys closing soon wow.       Wish mom had made wil  greed among family is a nightmare.    Good luck with that.    Really sad
I have been eating there for years love that place the best pizza around the Northwest side of Chicago in my opinion

Best pizza ever. Haven't had it in over a year because I no longer live in Chicago. The the pizza hasn't changed since as far back as I can remember in the late 70's when we'd call EV4-1755 and I'd go down with my dad to pick it up in the tavern. The pizza always takes me back to the good ol days.
Service is ok needs improvement

This is standard Chicago thin crust pizza. There is nothing special here. Considering the price, I downgraded to three stars because Vito and Angelos is a MUCH better deal. Service was also slow for takeout and building is less kitschy and more falling apart. I do not understand or trust all of the "best pizza in Chicago" because those people are clearly out of their minds.
Best thin crust pizza in town. I try not to move out of their delivery area

Ordered showed up late and incomplete.  Drivers cant be bothered to use a buzzer.  Food was not good and cold.  I knew this was going to happen eventually from this place.  Just surprised at the attitude I got when I called the restaurant asking about the remainder of my order!
Best taverns style pizza in Chicago. Hands down. Love this place

If you enjoy disgusting food made by people who can't cook (or dont care) and cheapskate management, then have at it and eat at this craphole. I ordered cajun chicken tenders and fries for delivery. This is what i got. The management offered no refund, just a 5 dollar off coupon for next order. No thanks, Ill pass.

The customer service here is horrible. My family and I have eaten there several times. Every time we hope the service gets better and it does not. There is a waitress there who is slightly nice but shes overworked. She never has any help so if the place gets busy, shes stuck serving everyone on her own and there is only so much she can do for one table. It's unfortunate because the food here is amazing. Possibly one of the best pizza places in Chicago hands down. However, the customer service alone draws my family and I away from eating or ordering from here. Today, I attempted ordering for delivery for the very last time. Today is officially the last time I will attempt to order from this pizzeria, whether it be dining in or for delivery. The person that answered the phone was probably one of the rudest people I have ever encountered in my entire life. I have ordered for delivery from here a few times in the past. The lady was attempting to charge me a higher delivery fee than I have ever been charged. Her customer service was just extremely off. She kept hanging up the phone on us. She was cursing at my husband and I. Sorry but for as good as your food may be, its not worth being treated as a nobody.  I never would have wrote a review because of how good the food is but her approach and her customer service skills needed to be addressed.
Best thin crust pizza in Chicago's northside. Order double sausage.
The customer service was good and the pizza was very good. We had a big group and the waitress did not miss a beat. Thank you
We go for the Al's beef. Great beefs!
The Food excellent as always!!! The can work the customer service
To me, my family and friends this is great pizza

Where you stop when you’re in the car with your boyfriend deciding what you should eat ;) Open late, tasty food, good service! One of my fav places in Chicago. Shrimp basket and mash potatoes are so delish! Plus don’t forget desert the sweet fried dough oh my Gawd
Woo this pizzas are huge .call in for pick up or eat in .old fashioned pizza joint restaurant
Neighborhood staple.  Great food with space for a family party or romantic dinner.  Bar & tv room inside.  Dine in, delivery or take out available.

My family as been ordering from here for over 25 years. I continue to eat here not because it’s a family tradition but because the pizza and almost everything on the menu is AMAZING. Great staff and atmosphere!
I've been eating at John's pizzeria for 30 years😍

Gordon Ramsey would have a field day saying how the place is outdated. That's all the charm. This place had massive dining areas, we sat in a booth with a vinyl tablecloth that was ripped and the table underneath was this gold speckled melamine top. The decor had a contrast to the photos in our booth which was the dining room from the 50s the paintings were hung crooked and the lighting fixtures were dusty. This place is a hipster goldmine. The food was great. The atmosphere was making me giddy
Very good pizza
The pizza was very thin like cardboard. Just something I wouldn't expect from a restaurant..I could have made a pizza at home better than this on.
Was so much better back in 90s its dirty staff is dirty floor is dirty my cup plate and fork was dirty. I grew up on this but I'll never be back
Best pizza in chicago
The Pizza is so delicious, and the cheese they use is "All that"
Have been going here for years..  It's changed.  The people the 🍕 the atmosphere..
Old school Chicago pizza 🍕.. 👌👍
Great late night old school pie and sauce. Thin crust pepperoni is a classic. Can grab a beer/wine if you're eating in...or while you wait for a pick up
Fried chicken is good!
Chicken sandwich wasn't good at all. Lettuce and tomato were old.
Real old school family style restaurant! Great Pizza!!
Great old school Chicago pub pizza joint. Fast delivery.
Really Good Pizza & Cheese Nachos I stay ordering from here anytime I’m up north and is too good and 5 Stars!
good pizza, but portions are shrinking
Love their pizza!!!
This place has a separate room just for large groups
Best pizza hands down in my book no competition.!!!!

Who ever took our order 11-2-18 7:25  was very unpleasant seemed like we were bothering her, asked questions about the menu she gave us a big sigh. Should train your staff to be more friendlier and knowledgeable.
My family been ordering from John's for year's... Great service and friendly people... I would recommend John pizza to all my customers and friends
Amazing Pizza! It is my favorite thin crust pizza in all of Chicago. I'm a big pizza fanatic but this place always hits the spot.
Neighborhood staple, family owned/operated/simple/affordable/typical Italian menu/my favorite for years
Great food

Good spot with excellent service and nice waiters. The pizza is a little greasy, but it is still worth its weight in gold. This is by far the best thin crust pizza spot in Chicago. The wings are decent too.

Great pizza place. The appatizers are cooked to perfection and the pizza... it is so worth it. Take out or dine in, the pizza is great. The waiting staff is great and the service is quick. The decor is a little inappropriate, but good to prank your friends with, if you know what I mean...😁😁
Divey and good!
Best pizza in town
The best
Great pizza but it always takes over an hour to deliver... it’s ridiculous and I live RIGHR DOWN THE STREET
Pizza was great
The best pizza ever
EXCELLENT PIZZA, AND SERVICE WE LUV❤JOHNS PIZZA!!!^*^

This is the best pizza anyone could ever eat yes I grew up on this pizza but I tried pizzas all over the place from here to California  to other places and never could find anything that could stand up to John's I just wish that they would move somewhere here in Highland Park because then I wouldn't have to go so far to get it and I go at least 2 or 3x a month that's how good it is.

A favorite place of mine for many years and decades. I recommend that you try their appetizers especially the fried cheese sticks. Their marinara sauce is excellent and their famous football pizzas are worth the trip. Parking is available across the street so finding a parking spot is not going to be an issue.
Love John's! Great food and friendly people
Our choice for thin crust. Love the Roman!
We love John's pizza😍😍😍  It's the best🥂🥂
Hands down the best thin crust pizza is here at Johns
Still good pizza and pasta.
Great pizza. Best pizza ever
Love this place. Always order delivery and the pizza is amazing
The best pizza in chicago!

If you're looking for ambiance this is not the place BUT the thin crust pizza is amazing!   The flavor is just fantastic!  I don't live near here anymore but was in the area and wanted to see if it was as good as it used to be...it is.
Awesome Pizza!

We were made to wait 20 minutes longer than expected for our food. The food was okay, and the staff were rude. The owner had to come out to try to smooth things out but by that time it was too late. The rest of the staff showed zero interest in taking care of us and we bought a good amount of food. Probably a last timer for me!
The pizza was pretty well done,  however it was very oily. Also,  when I went to pick up the pizza,  the restaurant had a very horrible smell. I will try going again here one day.
Best pizza in town!!
Been there once and by far best pizza. The price is high but you pay for what you get.
Grew up with this pizza my dad always bought, carrying tradition with my daughter.  Great thin crust sausage pizza!
Really gone down, decor and cleanliness were never the greatest. Now the pizza is terrible, wasted drive.
Nice staff, good food, and great atmosphere.    Well done y'all.
Good pizza good bbq chicken and fries but they are too pricey
Travel here from Michigan any chance we get. First town out of town with my boyfriend of five years and had to take him here and he loved it! Always friendly staff and out food was perfectly made.

Grew up eating here. It seemed better many years ago. Dined in for the second time ever and the experience was strange. They messed up my order and we did receive a discount but other than that the service was bad from the waitress and we were the only ones in the restaurant. The pizza isn't what it used to be.
Def my favorite thin square cut pizza in the neighborhood.
Definitely one of Chicago's best pizzas! Sausage well done is our favorite. Try to dine in for the crispiest, hottest, cheesiest experience!!?
One of my all time favorites. I always get the football size pizza whenever I go. Other menu dishes are excellent as well. By far the best pizza place in chicago.
It's a fair pizza joint to go to kinda expensive.

Give one Star to be nice, but I use to go there back in the day. But it's falling apart bathrooms are terrible. Service is not professional. This place needs an update real bad... Waitress is terrible too.
We came on a night where they were hosting a school sports team of at least 30 people.  Pizza was good but service was slow...extremely slow. Not sure why they only had one server that night.
The Best pizza around
Delicious pizza🍕🍕🍕🍕

Great pizza or the greatest pizza on the northside? Thin crust for the win. Been going here and ordering in for the better part of 4 decades and it's no secret to anyone who knows. Great sauce and a perfect crust. You could probably eat a whole pie by yourself.

I ordered a football pizza with peppers on all the pizza sausage on half The pizza and The other half with pinaple, Onion, Olive's .well I didn't get that and at that it was really salty so in my opinion the person who took the order got it right The cook failed
Super vintage spot. Pizza is delicious, fast service. All that’s needed is Jazz/blues music playing in the background. Perfect for dinner dates!

The back dining room is cool. Looks like a 50s living room.  Pizza is great and I have basically ordered the same pie several times here.  Front section of the building looks like a 50s diner.   This is on a major street on the northside of Chicago, yet most people don't know it exists.
Just ordered a pizza from johns and found a very long hair in my cooked pizza, really grossed me out. Will not be going back to this place again, how should I go about resolving this?

Just got our order. Been ordering and dining @johns for over 30 years. Today it comes to an unfortunate end. Had a talk to manager Quick to have all the answers on how food tasted and how it was presented to, us, the customer. A toss salad with what remained of old iceberg lettuce, with several pieces of diced tomato. Poppers which tasted like very bad freezer burn. A person from our party, decided to take a bite than threw one in garbage. Another diner took a bite and had to throw that half in garbage. 4 and half poppers, left on plate, we decided to call the restaurant. Manager had a problem when it was brought up to his attention. I explained  we never had a problem til today, Manager in his wisdom complained we had already eaten all the poppers and there would be NO refunds. Offered to refund price of salad, but that salad should have never been sent out. We took pictures, unfortunately unable to upload. Though one had to taste these items to know they were not very good. We didn't want a REFUND we wanted to know, WHY would they send out food in this condition.The manager was told the fried chicken dinners were good, never had any problems before. He took it upon himself to be condescending and accuse our party of eating all these poppers...etc and how we werent going to get a refund.... We lost our religion. Totally not worth ruining a Saturday night over, but enough to never order from there again. Hope everyone's experience will be better than ours.
Great pizza

I've been a customer for 15+ years, the pizza 🍕 is some of the best in Chicago, and they have a great Italian menu selection. Great for families, pretty nice size for events, a few flat screens, a full bar and it's on Western ave. The owner and staff have always been nice and professional. (Best waitress is Mari, she's so sweet and quick.)  The prices are fare especially for the area. Its an old favorite in the neighborhood.
Perfect date night location.

I was so disappointed with the size of the pizza, my hubby and me ordered a large pizza to pick up and when my husband brought it home i literally thought there was a mistake, the large pizza was so tiny and not even worth buying for the price. Never ordering here again smh
Ok food but I feel it's overpriced
Our favorite place for the football pizza, milkshakes, ribs be and lasagna.
We loved this thin crust so much we picked up another football pizza the next day.  It feeds about 4 adults and two kids who love pizza.
Traditional pizza place with a full bar. Pizza is forgettable with flimsy crust and uninteresting sauce. The decor is like a supper club time capsule and could use a refresh. Service was outstanding
Love Johns pizza on Western Ave.

This place is horrible. First off we order for pick up, and when we walk in to pick up they're 3 employees ignoring us and even asking if we need help. The only reason we didn't walk out is because these people already ran our cards. Here's the topper these " pizza experts" sold us a half under cooked pizza. Here is a is  for proof. Here is clear picture of there under cooked pizza.
Love the pizza. This is one of the best thin crusts I've had around town. They pile on generous portions of cheese and the sauce wasn't too sweet and had great flavor.

A close friend of mine took me here, and I had no idea what to expect. We obviously ordered the pizza (it's a pizza place) as the main entree. I was very impressed with the craftsmanship of the pizza. Hands down one of the best pizzas I've ever tasted. Why I really chose to write this review was because of their chicken wings. I was absolutely blown away by the flavor and texture of the wings. I had an out of body experience upon tasting these delicious things. It was like I died and went to heaven. With excellent service, great food, and an even better atmosphere you can't go wrong going here. I would recommend to anyone to stop into this amazing place. I plan on going back here every time I'm in the Chicago area. I might even make the 3 hour trip just to go here again!! It's that good!
Best thin crust in town!!!
Good pizza
Great old school pizza place, like a snapshot in time. Pizza is excellent here. Try Green Olive and Pepperoni

What ever happend to such a Chicago landmark for Pizza. I ordered a delivery earlier today, the delivery came as told however it my pizza was cold, old, and hard. I called to address the issue and all they offered was seven dollars credit. No fresh, hot or even my money back. Wow. Been a loyal customer for over 20 years and this is how they treat me.
The Best of the BEST PIZZA
Been dining here since the 70s. Pizza is still delicious, takes me back to my youth.
Pizza

My family has been dining at Johns Pizzeria for decades,and they have never done something this greedy before .I requested a half veggie and cheese pizza. John's used to give customers half off per topping when ordering toppings on only one half. Well, that changed today! I asked for the veggies they were charging veggies for a whole pizza.  I requested for the veggies I was not getting to please be placed on the side. The manager said no - he will only give be the veggies if they were cooked directly on the pizza. What?! John's pizzeria is ridiculous. Stealing from customers is unacceptable and unforgiving.

The place is in an epic time warp. While they do offer an entire menu of goodies I just order the pizza. It's solid, plenty of cheese and sauce, and baked right. Crispy edges and cooked all the way through... Your can eat inside or take out...
Not very good. The food was go honestly awful. I feel like we got overcharged as Well

Worked here for two months. Never so embarrassed to tell my friends where I work. The cooks rarely wash their hands (i answered phones and washed my hands more than the cooks on ANY given night), the kitchen is only mopped TWICE a week. their press for dough has had insects in it TWICE while working there, and the owner (his name is Larry, not John) allowed the kitchen to remain open, even while Orkin was there spraying chemicals. The owner and drivers are all homophobic, and still made jokes after telling them that it was inappropriate to do so. I WISH I could upload the photos I have of their kitchen. Avoid this place at all costs if you can.
The best thin crust in town

By far the worst customer service I ever had my food never got to me so I call in they say that they went even tho I never had a missed call and they never even knocked. Ok no biggie my order was already payed for I figured Id go in and pick it up myself. Well the manager comes out being extreamly rude saying if I want my order get it its in the garbage. I was in shock I couldnt belive this man said this to me I work for a restaurant and when something like this happens we remake it for our customers. We dont treat them like crap. I will definetly be telling everyone about my expirience with you guys.... YOU GUYS ARE THE WORST PIZZA JOINT I EVER ORDERDED FROM!!!! SAVE YOUR MONEY DONT GO HERE!!!!!
Best Pizza in the World!
Thin crust pizza is simply awesome
Best pizza in my life been eating that same pizza for over 30yrs still the best love you guys keep it up
Really good pizza, beverages and service. I am seriously considering this to be my favorite pizza place!

My buddy always orders from here, so about once a week he orders from here and the 4 times I've eaten the pizza it was pretty good. I'm a SUPER picky eater and each time I've eaten the pizza it's been good. I hate mushrooms and I'm not a big fan of sausage and he always orders a sausage and mushroom pizza. So, one night when the other pizzas we ordered were all gone, I tried a slice of the sausage and mushroom pizza. I couldn't believe that I liked it.  I'm not saying I'm gonna start eating sausage and mushroom but with 2 ingredients I don't like on a pizza that I ate 4 slices of definitely says slot. I'm a food critic and as far as the pizza goes, it's definitely worth the money
Delicious chicken and Italian beef.
Definitely authentic Italian pizza! Their chocolate cake rocks too!
Ehhh it's an okay place.  Service was mediocre and food was just okay
Great place if you want the greasiest pizza you can get. It was delicious but not a place I would order from often.
Favorite pizza in Chicago. Old school thin crust. To me this is Chicago style pizza.
Great pizza 😋😋

The pizza was good. Thin, cheesy, and with a crispy crust. The interior of the restaurant is humble and clean. The two employees I met were very friendly. Apparently you'll always get a free soda with the order. We'll definitely be eating pizza from here again.
Worst appetizer platter I've ever eaten. Served on a paper plate. Soggy and rubbery. Uncooked. Both our appetizers and pizza were cold. Bad experience
I was drunk and thought the pizza was great then the next day I ordered it and had an awful experience.  The drivers don't have the pizza warmers and it comes cold also the appetizers were atrocious
I order food from them and they gave me the wrong order, when I call to inform them of the mistake the girl on the phone was extremely rude to me and then hung up.

Old school feel, service is good. Thin crust pizza is one of my top ten. I come here also to eat their Fried Chicken. If ordering the fried chicken prepare to wait for it, cause it is cooked to order. It is crunchy and juicy at the same time. Comes with garlic bread and soup.
very very rude owner, the tables are never clean the food was good a long time ago but I don't know what happened. avoid avoid

Had this pizza for years and many times they have gotten my order wrong. The latest time I call and the manager gets on the phone and is completely rude. The attitude the management and workers have is not worth the quality of pizza. Never will waste my money here again.

Worst service. The girl was very rude on the phone. The pizza took over an hour and the driver texted me from his car that he was out front, and expected me to come to his car, I had to call to tell him where I was.  On top of that the pizza is soggy and the garlic bread came with no sauce.
The best

Spoke with John today after ordering from this restaurant and he's rude and the food is horrible!!!!!!!!!!! This is not a place to do business at!! I spent 23 dollars on food that I could have gotten from the hospital I work at NEVER EVER order for this place
Pleasant 👍👍 eat at least 3x a week ribs r tha best
One of the best old school Chicago style thin crust pizzas.   Ideal for delivery.  The dine-in experience is average.  4 stars because of the 'za.
I really hated this place, the cheese from my motzarella stick was all hard, not soft at all. The meatballs were burned!! And the lasagna was the greasiest one I've tried in my whole life

I used to hate Chicago thin crust pizza. I thought it was the worst thing in the world. I've lived less than 6 blocks away from John's Pizza for the past 5 years and I just tried it tonight. My mind is blown. Best Chicago-style thin crust pizza I've ever had. Amaaaazing

Worse experience in history! I called to place an order for deliver. While attempting to place my order to the lady over the phone, I was continuously put on hold without her saying "hold please". After a long process of me patiently waiting until she decided to take my order, I finally ordered a football size pizza and inquired if any drinks came with. She said Sierra Mist or Mountain Dew, so I asked if I could substitute with a  Pepsi instead and she said, your total is $38.02. So I asked again, could I substitute for a Coke or Pepsi, and again she said your total is $38.02. After this repetitive cycle continued for 5 rounds, I said it's ok please cancel  my order. If it wasn't in their policy to substitute, she could have just said no and I would have gladly paid the additional.  So it's 11pm and my relatives suggest ordering pizza, so  I gave John's pizza a second try to place an order and I was told they could not deliver to the address on file. I inquired why and Kimberly could not tell me why. So I asked to speak to the manager, who was in a "meeting" and she couldn't give me his name. I told her I would wait, 30 seconds later the meeting apparently was over. He wasn't very pleasant and told me to take my business somewhere else for canceling an order. He said me canceling the order caused him to lose money. This is puzzling to me because: 1. I cancelled the order before they made it and 2. By sending me elsewhere else he will lose money indefinitely. The way I was spoken to by every person who works there including the nameless manager did not exercise ethical practice. How hard is it to be courteous?  The management and staff should really invest in customer service and  ethics  classes to learn how to treat and serve people in their community.  A restaurant that doesn't value the QUALITY in customer service is a restaurant I don't want to eat at. Good thing I was visiting that area, never would I experience this where I live.
My all time favorite pizza..... Love the classic football Pizza with Sausage.
Best thin crust in chicago

Pizza arrived cold.  While the pizza was delivered within the delivery window, it was poorly packaged and delivered.  Every time I have ordered delivery pizza here in Chicago (100s of deliveries), it came in a thick cardboard box that was then placed in a thermal bag which was used for transport.  John's Pizzeria Ristorante packages their delivery pizza orders in a thin paper bag (the pizza is placed on a cardboard disk).  Then the bagged pizza is placed in a cardboard box which the delivery guy uses as a carrier.  It looks like a shipping box you could get from the UPS store.  It doesn't take an engineer to figure out the pizza will cool off quickly when packaged like that.  The pizza was cold and stuck to the cardboard.  Waste of $30.  I could of ordered Dominos and gotten two medium one topping pizzas, some chicken thing and a 2 liter of Coke for $20.  While Dominos isn't the greatest pizza out there but at least warm pizza from Dominos is more enjoyable than a cold, semi chewy pizza from John's Pizzeria Ristorante. Poorly managed operation. (Also, what is with charging for crushed pepper?  You can keep corner cutting but it will all catch up with you.  Margins on pizza are high, there is no reason to corner cut so much.)
Great pizza!

I ordered a pizza from these guys and it showed up with the wrong topping. No big deal, I figured I'd just call and ask for a replacement. They assured me I'd get one. It never showed up. Don't trust these people, they break their promises.

Worst experiance getting pizza. As a Chicago resident and an avid pizza eater these guys are the definition of disappointment. It took them an hour and twenty minutes to deliver my order after being told it would be delivered with in the hour. Once the driver arrived I called and spoke with their kitchen manager who offered to discount my order for 9 dollars. I accepted that. Once I opened the pizza i quickly noticed it was cold. The cheese had already hardened. I called back again stated even more disappointment. They offered to send me another pizza and to have the old pizza packaged up to be returned to the driver. ( Why would I wait another hour at best so they can send me another order?) I said thats okay, you can have your driver come pick up this pizza refund my money and I'll order from another establishment. The manager said "That's fine ill refund your money but don't EVER call here again" SIR, WITH PLEASURE! I will never call you guys for a cold late pizza again. For a company that delivers 100's of pizzas a day you must send a lot of cold dough. Step your game up John's. This is Chicago. I can get a nice hot slice from plenty of other qualified pizzerias!
Good pizza

The calzones here are mouthwatering, the rest of the selection is pretty good too. The service is TERRIBLE though. I went inside during the hours in which it was OPEN, and nobody helped. We asked people working, and they dismissed us. Also, the inside is absolutely disgusting. I wouldn't be surprised to find a rat tail inside my calzone.

This place honestly sucks. Bought a $15.00 appetizer platter and it comes in a paper plate, it was mushy too! What A Waste!!! The pizza didn't taste right and neither did the garlic dressing, first time ordering from here and never doing it again. $70.00 waste
Greek pizza
Best pizza in the city! hands down

Good pizza. They stick to pretty much the same old tried and true pizza recipe you see with all the decent pizza shops. Hey it works so more power to them! Delivery was pretty quick since I live around the corner anyway.
The pizza here is great. I never expected it from this kinda ratty looking inside. But none the less I enjoy there take out very much.
This place never changes, I moved to Texas four years ago and just visited. Thank God for a place that doesn't change the food. Great pizza.
A great place to get pizza from,  their suace is AMAZING.  And if you live close enough their fried food on delivery is really good.

John's has one of the best thin-crust pizzas in Chicago. If you like pizza, you owe it to yourself to try it. They deliver quick, or if you want to eat in it's a 60's wood-paneled basement time warp with cheap pitchers of beer. Three thumbs up.

John's Pizza is the best thin crust pizza in Chicago hands down. Born and raised in Bucktown and have been eating this pizza for about 20 years now. The hacks who write negative reviews don't know good pizza and probably used to live in the burbs eating Pizza Hut as their "local" pizza.
